oai_dc:dc.dc:title: F. G. R. Club has weiner roast and dance, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940), about the F. G. R. Club. The caption reads: “Members of the F. G. R. Club entertained recently with a weiner roast at Sycamore Lodge. Members seen at the entertainment, from left to right, are as follows: seated, Janelle Melton, Sarah Hanna, Sarah Crafton, president; Helen Cooper, treasurer; Lila Merritt, Jean Moore, Dorothy Johnson, Eula Harris; standing, Lucian Wooten, sergeant-at-arms; Tommy Dennison, William Hobson, Baxter Courduff, Virginia Russell, Raymon Hackney, Howard Allen, vice-president; Ann Derryberry, Edward Baggett, Tommy McGinnis, Tommy Knowles; top row, Robert Nicholson and Gladys Hackney. Dancing was the diversion of the evening.” Sycamore Lodge, located in Shelby Park, Nashville. Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
